page.title: 07FAMILY LIFE IN DIDSBURY
page.content: The average family in Didsbury has {two children.}Often both parents work outside the home.Women stop work to have a baby but many return soon afterwards.{Mothers}are usually the ones to have time off to look after sick children. { Television}is very important in most families.Sometimes programmes are watched together but there can be friction when there is a question of priorities in viewing time. { Activities}in which families join in together include eating meals both at home and in restaurants, visiting relatives,sports, walking in the countryside and going to places of interest. Once children start full-time school families see most of each other on {holiday.}This may be home or abroad. Travel is usually in the family car.
